snippet: President Obama and Prime Minister David Cameron of Britain have taken generally cautious and deliberate approaches to the Syrian conflict.
abstract: Pres Obama and British Prime Min David Cameron, after meeting at White House, say that it is urgent to bring fighting in Syria to an end, while acknowledging that diplomatic effort to stem bloodshed is an uphill struggle that might well fail; leaders sketch generally cautious program for strengthening Syria's armed opposition.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and MICHAEL D. SHEAR

lead_paragraph: President Obama and Prime Minister David Cameron of Britain have taken generally cautious and deliberate approaches to the Syrian conflict.

headline.seo: Obama and Cameron Press Putin on Syria
headline.main: A Focus on Syria for Obama and Cameron
headline.print_headline: A Focus on Syria for Obama and Cameron
